vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<str.size();j++){

                prefixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j+1));
            }
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}

"
This function willt ake a ve ctor of integers. For all entries in the vector, the function shall squ areth einteger  en try if  its index is a 
multipl e of  3 and will cube t h e integer entry if its index is a  multi ple of 4 and not a multip le of 3. The function will not 
change the entries in thevector whose indexes ar e nota multiple of 3 or 4.T he functio n shall then re turn the sumof all entries. 

Examples:
For lst = {1,2,3} the output should be 6
For lst = {}  the output should be 0
For lst = {-1,-5,2,-1,-5}  the output should be -126
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
int sum_squares(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%2==0){
            sum+=lst[i]*lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}
int sum_cubes(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%4==0){
            sum+=lst[i]*lst[i]*lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}
int sum_multiples(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%3==0 || lst[i]%4==0){
            sum+=lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

Given two vectors ope r ator, an d operand. The first vector has basic algebra operations,and 
the seco nd vec to r is avec tor of  integers. Use the two g iven  vectors to buildt he algebric 
expressionand retur n theevaluation of this expres sion.

The basic algebra operations:
Addition ( + ) 
Subtr action ( - ) 
Multiplic ation( * ) 
Floor division(  // ) 
Exp onentiation ( * * ) 

Example:
operator{"+", "*", "-"}
vector = {2, 3, 4, 5}
result = 2 + 3 * 4 - 5
=> result = 9

Note:
    The length of operator vector is equal to the length of operand vector minus one.
    Operand is a vector of of non-negative integers.
    Operator vector has at least one operator, and operand vector has at least two operands.

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>

#include<string>

#include<algorithm>
#include<stdlib.h>
int do_algebra(vector<string> operato, vector<int> operand){

        operator.push_back(operato[i]);
        i++;
    }
    i=0;
    while(operand.size()>i){
        result.push_back(operand[i]);
        i++;
    }
    i=0;
    while(operator.size()>i){
        switch(operator[i]){
            case "+":
                result.push_back(operand[i]+operand[i+1]);
                i++;
                break;
            case "-":
                result.push_back(operand[i]-operand[i+1]);
                i++;
                break;
            case "*":
                result.push_back(operand[i]*operand[i+1]);
                i++;
                break;
            case "/":
                result.push_back(operand[i]/operand[i+1]);
                i++;
                break;
            case "//":
                result.push_back(operand[i]/operand[i+1]);
                i++;
                break;
            case "**":
                result.push_back(operand[i]*operand[i+1]);
                i++;
                break;
            default:
                cout<<"error"<<endl;
                break;
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true is vector elements  are monotonically increasing or decreasing.
>>> monotonic({1, 2, 4, 20})
true
>>> monotonic({1, 20, 4, 10})
false
>>> monotonic({4, 1, 0, -10})
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool monotonic(vector<float> l){
    float min = l[0];
    float max = l[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] < min){
            min = l[i];
        }
        if(l[i] > max){
            max = l[i];
        }
    }
    if(min == max){
        return true;
    }
    return false;
}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> parse_nested_parens(string paren_string){
    vector<int> paren_level;
    int paren_level_count = 0;
    for(int i=0;i<paren_string.length();i++){
        if(paren_string[i]=='('){
            paren_level_count++;
        }
        if(paren_string[i]==')'){
            paren_level_count--;
        }
        if(paren_level_count==0){
            paren_level.push_back(paren_level_count);
        }
    }
    return paren_level;
}

The function below is called "factorial" because it returns the factorial of a number.
*/
int factorial(int n){
    if(n == 0){
        return 1;
    }
    else{
        return n * factorial(n-1);
    }
}

The function below is called "fibonacci" because it returns the nth fibonacci number.

int fibonacci(int n){
    if(n == 0){
        return 0;
    }
    else if(n == 1){
        return 1;
    }
    else{
        return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2);
    }
}
